channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: The powerful banking regulator says it will revise the guidance that prompted banks to defer billions in dividend payments.
item.title: Bank dividend guidance moves on from 'emergency' settings

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Despite the season starting in less than 10 days, clubs have still not been told how the shot will be signalled to players on-court.
item.title: 'Out of our control': Netballers still in dark on controversial 'super shot' rule

item.dc:creator: Greg Baum
item.description: Prompted by a Netflix documentary, a score of Australian gymnasts have taken to social media to lift the lid on a brutal culture.
item.title: 'The abuse needs to stop': Australian ex-gymnasts lash out

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Victoria to implement face mask mandate on Thursday, while NSW remains on high alert as the coronavirus pandemic continues.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victoria records 484 new COVID-19 cases as Thai Rock Wetherill Park cluster grows in NSW; Australian death toll stands at 128

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: The regulator's inquiry comes amid complaints from lawyers who say they had to keep working in the office during the pandemic.
item.title: WorkSafe investigates Melbourne law firm after positive cases

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: Underworld figure Mick Gatto has claimed barrister-turned-police informer Nicola Gobbo offered to testify on his behalf to refute an allegation that he once threatened to kill her.
item.title: 'Gobbo will testify for me' says underworld figure Mick Gatto

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Pauline Hanson's chief-of-staff is suing the Commonwealth to recover almost $4 million he incurred in legal costs pursuing his former boss Peter Slipper in court.
item.title: James Ashby sues Commonwealth over $4 million legal bill in Slipper case

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: Kevin Pettiford slashed the guard's arm as his lunch was handed to him through a hatch in his cell door at Goulburn Supermax.
item.title: Man nicknamed 'Hand of death' jailed after slashing prison guard with razor

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: ASX-listed miner OZ Minerals has raised its full-year copper and gold production targets following an impressive first-half performance.
item.title: OZ Minerals hikes copper, gold targets as prices run hot

item.dc:creator: Scott Spits
item.description: Essendon coach John Worsfold admits the Bombers are still searching for the ideal forward structure as they manage the long-term absence of Joe Daniher and with Jake Stringer also sidelined.
item.title: Bombers still looking for the best forward mix: Worsfold

item.description: In early autumn, On The Lead announced himself as a potential carnival horse, hitting the line nicely on debut at Canterbury.
item.title: Kembla feature offers a solid lead for colt's chances in spring

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on an seven-race card.
item.title: Race-by-race guide and tips for Kembla on Thursday

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Premiership coach Denis Pagan is now a city-winning trainer with just his fourth runner after Frankie Two Angels saluted at Sandown on Wednesday.
item.title: Pagan adds city-winning trainer to his CV

item.dc:creator: Mags King
item.description: Our photographs are more than the first draft of history; they’re powerful gut punches that force everyone from politicians and philanthropists to suburban mums and dads to sit up and take notice.
item.title: Photojournalism from the frontline: a year unlike any other

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: The fact the new pandemic income support program is being attacked from the left and right suggests it is steering up the middle.
item.title: Reworked income support package strikes the right balance

item.description: Are whales really just food? This doco focuses on the upfront whale hunting in Scandinavia.
item.title: What's on TV: Tuesday, July 28

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Marco Rojas is under no illusions about the task facing injury ravaged Victory, but he says it is time for he and the other senior players to show leadership
item.title: No Toivenen or Kruse means Rojas has to step up, and he knows it

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: COVID-19 is the black swan event that insurers couldn’t predict and actuaries will find difficult to model.
item.title: QBE's hot spot 'worry' list reveals extent of pandemic catastrophe

item.description: In this instalment of SVU, the vic is a young artist supporting herself working in a strip club.
item.title: What's on TV: Thursday, July 30

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Victoria's struggles will lower growth in the national economy in the September quarter and could also increase the country's unemployment rate.
item.title: Victoria lockdowns to cost national economy at least $3 billion

item.description: The journey Nyong'o takes through what is now Benin is full of fascinating facts and cultural insights.
item.title: What's on TV: Wednesday, July 29

item.dc:creator: Jason Steger
item.description: The festival has launched this year’s online iteration with a pay-what-you-can ticketing option.
item.title: Time to pay attention at the new-look Melbourne Writers Festival

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: The $3 million move to sign Joseph Suaalii seems like madness at first glance but there could be more to it than meets the eye.
item.title: Why rugby's $3m gamble on teen could end up being a safe bet

item.description: They do everything bigger in Texas, including their 911 incidents. Enter fire captain Owen Strand.
item.title: What's on TV: Monday, July 27

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: The Rare earths miner says it is expecting higher demand for its ores in the current half year after the COVID-related shutdown of its Malaysian operations crippled production for the June quarter.
item.title: Lynas touts geopolitical strength as production takes a pandemic hit

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Victoria Police says it acted lawfully when it informed Racing Victoria that it found six syringes containing traces of EPO in a bedside drawer of trainer Jarrod McLean's Yangery home in January 2019.
item.title: Police should have kept EPO syringes to themselves, says McLean

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Qantas and Jetstar will make mask use mandatory for passengers on all flights to and from Melbourne and say the policy could extend to other routes.
item.title: Qantas to make masks compulsory on all Melbourne flights

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: Frozen yoghurt stores that were the last part of celebrity chef George Calombaris' food empire have been sold to sons of Boost Juice entrepreneur Janine Allis.
item.title: Final nail for Calombaris empire as Boost founder's boys buy Yo-Chi

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.description: Asians Australians may have won the contest most often, but this year's MasterChef was stacked against them, argues one disappointed viewer.
item.title: All white on the night: when MasterChef hit the 'bamboo ceiling', this Asian-Australian stopped watching

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Police believe 185 people ordered into self-quarantine gave fake addresses so they could give authorities the slip, though the risk posed by most had now 'passed'.
item.title: Premier not concerned about spread as LNP calls for $13,000 fines on quarantine liars

item.dc:creator: Ben Pobjie
item.description: Can Gudinski's new television endeavour The Sound fill the same cultural space that Countdown did?
item.title: Music production maestro Michael Gudinski moves into TV

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: It didn't take Boe Pahari long to make waves and changes with his executive team at AMP Capital.
item.title: AMP Capital's controversial new boss shuffles management deck

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: He hasn't played in the NRL since 2014, but Sonny Bill Williams could again be a Rooster by the end of the season.
item.title: Roosters on the verge of Sonny Bill Williams signing as he considers NRL return for final four rounds and finals

item.description: Iain Lees-Galloway had a consensual affair for about a year with a woman who had worked as a staff member in his office, the New Zealand Prime Minister said
item.title: Ardern dismisses minister over claims of inappropriate relationship

item.dc:creator: Kylie Northover
item.description: Seven's rebooted The Farmer Wants A Wife is flirty and fun, but much more wholesome than many other reality dating programs.
item.title: Farmer reboot a breath of clean air

item.dc:creator: Ben Pobjie
item.description: Actress Katrina Milosevic has become the staunchest supporter of hardened crim Sue "Boomer" Jenkins during her eight-season stint inside Wentworth Correctional Centre.
item.title: Wentworth's most beloved inmate prepares for the show's last hurrah

item.dc:creator: Michael Gleeson
item.description: In this toughest concentration of games, undoubtedly the team with the most punishing fixture is the league's biggest team.
item.title: Pies punished, Hawks gifted in latest fixture release

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: Western Sydney developer Jean Nassif is suing the 2GB host for defamation over a series of broadcasts about his residential projects.
item.title: Ray Hadley sued by developer behind 'Congratulations Mrs Nassif' meme

item.dc:creator: David Prestipino
item.description: Normal programming will officially resume in the west this weekend when Bunnings fires up its famed sausage sizzles outside selected stores.
item.title: Bunnings sausage sizzles return in WA this weekend

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: In this episode, climate and environment editor Nick O'Malley is joined by climate and energy reporter Mike Foley to discuss the review of the Environment Protection and Biodiversity Conservation Act.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: Why is Australia's environment in an 'unsustainable state of decline'

item.dc:creator: Ben Pobjie
item.description: In the role of sideline reporter, the AFL legend's natural instincts took over, not just interacting with competitors but giving The Warped Wall a crack.
item.title: Shane Crawford couldn't resist Ninja Warrior's warped wall challenge

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Questions are being asked about how commissioner of Australia's building watchdog received exemption to fly to Brisbane to speak to two Cross River Rail workers.
item.title: Melbourne investigator gets COVID-19 pass to grill Brisbane workers

item.dc:creator: Natalie Reilly
item.description: The sight of people suddenly masking up can be a little terrifying for children, but the way you communicate can help.
item.title: How to explain masks to children without creating fear

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: Paddy Evans was woken up by the fire alarm and recalls a potent smell in the hostel.
item.title: 'We just watched the restaurant burn': Backpacker loses 'second home'

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Dr Peter Ridd was awarded $1.2 million in damages by the Federal Circuit Court in September, which had earlier found JCU sacked the physics professor unlawfully.
item.title: James Cook University to appeal over unlawful sacking decision

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Property Council says a delay until 2021 to sign the City Deal means delays to economic recovery but Queensland's Treasurer rejects the claim.
item.title: Delay in billion-dollar City Deal a 'cruel blow' to Queensland recovery

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: With out-of-home entertainment options shrinking, subscription television services have recorded substantial gains in viewership.
item.title: Streaming services and pay TV the big winners of pandemic shutdown

item.description: The court dimensions are unchanged. Everything else about an NBA game set-up is new.
item.title: A whole new look for a whole new NBA game experience

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Versatile St Kilda tall Josh Battle suffered a facial fracture in his nasty collision with teammate Paddy Ryder during the Saints' win over Adelaide on Monday night.
item.title: Battle scars: Saint suffers facial fracture
